results.deck: King of Colosseum Green is a Japanese wrestling game, featuring the Zero-One and Pro Wrestling NOAH promotions.
results.name: King of Colosseum Green

results.deck: A action game based on the TV series.
results.name: James Cameron's Dark Angel

results.deck: A fantasy turn-based strategy role-playing game that was released only in Japan.
results.name: Dragon Shadow Spell

results.deck: A collection of all the Real Bout Fatal Fury games.
results.name: Fatal Fury: Battle Archives Volume 2

results.deck: Known in Japan as Poison Pink, Eternal Poison is a dark tactical RPG.
results.name: Eternal Poison

results.deck: Released internationally as Atlantis III: The New World
results.name: Beyond Atlantis II

results.deck: Kengo: Master of Bushido is a 2001 sword duel fighting game, set in feudal Japan. Gameplay is heavily focused on training and improving your skills through the use of mini-games and battling opponents to become a "Master of Bushido".
results.name: Kengo: Master of Bushido

results.deck: Backyard Baseball is a 3D cartoon baseball sim.
results.name: Backyard Baseball 2007

results.deck: The second game in the World Championship Snooker franchise.
results.name: World Championship Snooker 2002

results.deck: A vertical shoot 'em up developed by Cave.
results.name: Ibara

results.deck: Taito Memories Joukan (Vol. 1) compiles 25 Taito arcade games and was released in Japan for the PS2.
results.name: Taito Memories Joukan

results.deck: Taito Memories Gekan (Vol. 2) compiles 25 Taito arcade games and was released in Japan for the PS2.
results.name: Taito Memories Gekan

results.deck: Contains 3 games made by Treasure. Gunstar Heroes, Alien Soldier and Dynamite Headdy.
results.name: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol. 25: Gunstar Heroes Treasure Box

results.deck: SD Gundam G Generation Spirits is a strategy game that is focused on Gundam's "Universal Century" timeline; it covers nearly every UC Gundam series from the original 1979 anime to Victory Gundam, including several manga and videogames never before seen in G Generation.
results.name: SD Gundam G Generation Spirits

results.deck: The Document of Metal Gear Solid 2 is an interactive developer guide through Metal Gear Solid 2
results.name: The Document of Metal Gear Solid 2

results.deck: The first game in the long running drum music rhythm game series. It was first released in Japanese arcades in 1999, and then released as a Japanese PS2 launch title in 2000. Some arcades outside of Asia have imported the machine.
results.name: DrumMania

results.deck: The 4th game in the Guitar Freaks series.
results.name: GuitarFreaks 4thMIX

results.deck: Due out around the holiday season this year is Disney TH!NK Fast, a four player family trivia game for Wii and PlayStation 2. Developed by Magenta Software (Buzz!), the game will offer both multiple-choice questions and mini-game challenges.
results.name: Disney Th!nk Fast

results.deck: Nanobreaker is a hack-and-slash game set in an apocalyptic future populated by "Orgamechs" and is most notably known for the copious amount of blood spilled during combat.
results.name: Nano Breaker

results.deck: This game is essentially Virtua Fighter 4 Evo redone in the primitive graphics from the original Virtua Fighter. Bundled with VF4 for PS2.
results.name: Virtua Fighter 10th Anniversary

results.deck: Narc is a 3rd person shooter in which you play as two DEA agents trying to trace a new drug called Liquid Soul. You play through gritty urban environments and are able to either become a good or a bad cop through a badge rating system.
results.name: NARC

results.deck: Puyo Puyo 15th Anniversary game. Came out for PS2, PSP Wii and DS
results.name: Puyo Puyo 15th Anniversary

results.deck: A very odd 3D puzzle game published by Sony Computer entertainment. Unlike other puzzlers you play as a person in a 3D enviroment.
results.name: Mawaza

results.deck: A prequel to Dragon Quest VIII featuring Yangus as the main character.
results.name: Dragon Quest: Shounen Yangus to Fushigi no Dungeon

results.deck: Based on the original television show, Battlestar Galactica is a space combat game pitting the ragtag Colonial army against the imperialistic Cylon centurions.
results.name: Battlestar Galactica

results.deck: Released in the UK in conjunction with the 2006/2007 Ashes series, Cricket 07 is a cricket simulation developed by EA Sports
results.name: Cricket 07

results.deck: Stuart Little is back in New York where he can ride a variety of vehicles (with EyeToy support).
results.name: Stuart Little 3: Big Photo Adventure

results.deck: A light gun game in which the player assumes the role of Yuri or Kou Yanami, and with the ancient super gun known as the Crimson, saves Lily who has been kidnapped by the evil forces.
results.name: Death Crimson OX

results.deck: Play NBA with the stars on the Sega Dreamcast.
results.name: ESPN NBA 2Night

results.deck: A boys' love visual novel RPG.
results.name: Angel's Feather

results.deck: This expansion provides new levels, items, skills difficulty settings, and other enhancements to the original game.
results.name: Samurai Warriors: Xtreme Legends

results.deck: The second Samurai Warriors title sees an expanded roster and new selection of battlefields. Players fight through campaigns focused on historical figures of the Warring States era.
results.name: Samurai Warriors 2

results.deck: Galactic Wrestling: Featuring Ultimate Muscle is a game based on the animated series Ultimate Muscle.  It was developed by AKI Corp. and published  by Bandai.
results.name: Galactic Wrestling: Featuring Ultimate Muscle

results.deck: A budget title loosely based on the motion picture, released only in Europe for PlayStation 2. It is a top-down stealth action game of sorts, in which 1-2 players must eliminate burglars from a house by using wacky improvised weapons and locking doors.
results.name: Home Alone

results.deck: Create, test and ride seven types of roller coasters in Rollercoaster World.
results.name: Rollercoaster World

results.deck: Play through a collection of family board games in a variety of settings.
results.name: Junior Board Games

results.deck: Wash cars and build up a reputation in the carwashing business.
results.name: Carwash Tycoon

results.deck: Naruto: Ultimate Ninja is the first Naruto fighting game on the PS2.
results.name: Naruto: Ultimate Ninja

results.deck: The sequel to Super Robot Taisen Original Generation 1 & 2/Super Robot Taisen OG: OGs which has OG1, OG2 and 2.5.
results.name: Super Robot Wars Original Generation Gaiden

results.deck: Based on the motion picture, The Water Horse: Legend of the Deep allows you to embark on an adventure in growing the 'Water Horse' and releasing to the open sea.
results.name: The Water Horse: Legend of the Deep

results.deck: You play as a former member of the Delta Force turned SWAT. You lead a team of operatives through various missions with multiple mission objectives.
results.name: SWAT:  Global Strike Team

results.deck: This is a soccer game in the World Tour Soccer franchise. It lets you create a character based on yourself by scanning your face with the PS2's EyeToy.
results.name: World Tour Soccer 2006

results.deck: Clannad is a visual novel developed by Key and released on April 2004 in Japan, first on the PC and later on the PS2 in 2006 and the PSP and Xbox 360 in 2008. With an acclaimed interactive narrative revolving around a family theme, it was adapted into an equally acclaimed anime series.
results.name: Clannad

results.deck: Air is an adult visual novel game developed by Key. The game was released on the PC on September 8, 2000 in Japan. The all ages versions of the game later came to PS2, Dreamcast, PSP, SoftBank 3G and FOMA cell phones.
results.name: Air

results.deck: A spin-off of Clannad which expands on the story of Tomoyo Sakagami, one of the heroines of the original title. Features a strategy RPG mini-game which has its own story.
results.name: Tomoyo After: It's a Wonderful Life

results.deck: A visual novel game developed by Key. The game was released in 2007 in Japan on the PC. An adult version of the game, retitled Little Busters! Ecstasy, was released on the PC a year later on July 25, 2008.
results.name: Little Busters!

results.deck: Play five minigames in Roller Coaster Funfare - mini golf, bumper cars, airboats, football and 'Shoot in the Saloon'.
results.name: Roller Coaster Funfare

results.deck: A Singstar game featuring only norwegian songs. The game was only released in Norway.
results.name: Singstar Norsk på Norsk

results.deck: A visual novel with both adult and teen rated versions.
results.name: Happiness!

results.deck: Free Running is the first extreme sports game that focuses on parkour. Players can race, perform tricks or work to reach a difficult spot in the various urban arenas, all the while trying to keep up the flow of their movements.
results.name: Free Running

results.deck: A visual novel with both adult and teen rated versions. It was the debut title of Makura.
results.name: H2O: Footprints in the Sand

results.deck: A video game based on the manga and anime series.
results.name: Ikki Tousen: Shining Dragon

results.deck: A planned sequel to 1995's Full Throttle, this time for Xbox and PS2 as well as PC. It was cancelled by LucasArts.
results.name: Full Throttle: Hell on Wheels

results.deck: From legendary video game producer Kou Shibusawa comes his next historical simulation masterpiece. Rediscover an ancient civilization with an explosive history in the most stunning edition of Romance of the Three Kingdoms.
results.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms XI

results.deck: Test Drive is a racing game developed by Pitbull Syndicate. In Test Drive, you play as Dennis Black, a street racer who is contacted by a wheelchair-bound man and hired to race in his place in a series of underground street races known as "test drives".
results.name: Test Drive

results.deck: A visual novel based on the Haruhi Suzumiya franchise where you take the role of Kyon who has been tasked to organize the development SOS Brigade's first video game.
results.name: Suzumiya Haruhi no Tomadoi

results.deck: A visual novel about Mizuho Miyanokouji a young man who must attend Seio Girls' Academy disguised as a girl, a final wish of his late grandfather's will.
results.name: Otome wa Boku ni Koishiteru

results.deck: A visual novel with RPG elements based on the lightnovel/anime/manga of the same name.
results.name: Shakugan no Shana

results.deck: A visual novel based on the anime of the same name.
results.name: Zero no Tsukaima: Shouakuma to Shunpuu Concerto

results.deck: Agassi: Tennis Generation is a relatively simple tennis game developed by Aqua Pacific featuring 3 different game modes.
results.name: Agassi Tennis Generation

results.deck: PS2 remake of the PS1 orginal. Was later ported to the PSP with additional extras as "Zill O'll Infinite Plus."
results.name: Zill O'll Infinite

results.deck: The first game in the series of otome dating sims that brought many new fans to the genre.
results.name: Tokimeki Memorial Girl's Side

results.deck: Use the EyeToy camera to play out the role of a spy. Mission include stealthy sky diving, code breaking, face matching, and more.
results.name: EyeToy: Operation Spy

results.deck: A visual novel based on the Princess Princess anime.
results.name: Princess Princess: Himetachi no Abunai Houkago

results.deck: Use Buzz! controllers to play mini games as a group of Jungle Monkeys. Great fun with simple controls for youngsters to play.
results.name: Buzz! Junior: Jungle Party

results.deck: An otome visual novel with a gothic setting developed by Karin Entertainment.
results.name: Princess Nightmare

results.deck: The third game in the popular Angelique series of otome dating sims.
results.name: Angelique Trois

results.deck: A  visual novel otome game set in feudal Japan.
results.name: Yo-Jin-Bo: The Bodyguards

results.deck: The fourth installment in the popular Angelique series.
results.name: Angelique Etoile

results.deck: Chronologically the fifth installment in the Angelique series, but it is actually a complete renewal of the series with all new characters.
results.name: Neo Angelique

results.deck: In this game you face off foes in a maze, a high on action maze.
results.name: Maze Action

results.deck: A visual novel otome game by Idea Factory.
results.name: Hiiro no Kakera

results.deck: The second game in Konami's popular franchise of otome dating sims. It was originally released for PS2 as "2nd Kiss," and later received an enhanced release on the DS as "2nd Season."
results.name: Tokimeki Memorial Girl's Side: 2nd Kiss

results.deck: A visual novel by Circus.
results.name: D.C. Da Capo

results.deck: The first entry in the Demonbane series of visual novels by Nitroplus.
results.name: Deus Machina Demonbane

results.deck: A visual novel based on the anime of the same name. The name Ai Yori Aoshi comes from the quote "Blue comes from indigo, yet is bluer than indigo", meaning that people surpass their teachers through their own efforts.
results.name: Ai Yori Aoshi

results.deck: SingStar: Singalong With Disney is a SingStar title made exclusively for PAL territories, featuring songs from an array of Disney movies.
results.name: SingStar: Singalong with Disney

results.deck: SingStar: Queen is a SingStar title featuring songs by the band Queen.
results.name: SingStar: Queen

results.deck: Marking the last appearance of the Dragon Ball Z franchise on the Playstation 2, Infinite World sought to take the best features of each of the previous Budokai games and roll them into one.
results.name: Dragon Ball Z: Infinite World

results.deck: The tenth iteration of the Samurai Shodown fighting series. Features all the characters from the previous games, plus a few more, and is a "dream match" installment.
results.name: Samurai Shodown VI

results.deck: A visual novel based on the My-Hime anime series, offering an alternate take on the plot.
results.name: Mai-HiME: Unmei no Keitouju

results.deck: A fighting game based on the My-Otome anime series.
results.name: Mai-Otome: Otome Butou Shi

results.deck: To Heart 2 is a visual novel by Aquaplus.
results.name: To Heart 2

results.deck: Silent Line Armored Core is the second game in the 3rd set of Armored Core games. Its also the 7th game over all.
results.name: Silent Line: Armored Core

results.deck: An "educational" game for the Nintendo 64 and Playstation 2. You learn about numbers or something.
results.name: Elmo's Number Journey

results.deck: Keyboardmania (alternately KEYBOARD MANIA, and abbreviated KBM) is a rhythm video game created by the Bemani division of Konami.
results.name: Keyboardmania

results.deck: Another entry in the Pia Carrot series of adult visual novels.
results.name: Pia Carrot e Youkoso!! G.P.

results.deck: An adult visual novel in the Pia Carrot series.
results.name: Pia Carrot e Youkoso!! G.O.

results.deck: The second visual novel based on the Zero no Tsukaima anime.
results.name: Zero no Tsukaima: Muma ga Tsumugu Yokaze no Gensoukyoku

results.deck: Zatch Bell!: Mamodo fury is a fighting game based off the popular anime Zatch Bell!
results.name: Zatch Bell! Mamodo Fury

results.deck: This is the ps2 game that Monster Hunter Freedom 2 is ported from. It is a Japanese only release that expanded the formula started with the first Monster Hunter.
results.name: Monster Hunter 2

results.deck: The first game based on the popular animated kids show.
results.name: Winx Club

results.deck: Dynasty Warriors: Gundam 2 is the sequel to Bandai and Koei's Gundam/Dynasty Warriors mash-up.
results.name: Dynasty Warriors: Gundam 2

results.deck: As Tsukasa Sawamura you must navigate the ins and outs of your newfound family life.
results.name: Family Project

results.deck: Rozen Maiden: Duellwalzer is a visual novel game, based on the Rozen Maiden anime / manga.
results.name: Rozen Maiden: duellwalzer

results.deck: Rozen Maiden: gebetgarten is a 3D fighting game featuring characters from the Rozen Maiden manga / anime series.
results.name: Rozen Maiden: gebetgarten

results.deck: Utawarerumono is a linear visual novel developed by Leaf that also includes tactical RPG segments.
results.name: Utawarerumono

results.deck: Based around the lovable Shamu from SeaWorld.
results.name: Sea World: Shamu's Deep Sea Adventures

results.deck: Fourth game in the AeroWings / Aero Dancing series.
results.name: Aero Elite: Combat Academy

results.deck: Lucky Star: Ryouou Gakuen Outousai is a visual novel featuring characters from the four-panel manga and anime Lucky Star.
results.name: Lucky Star: Ryouou Gakuen Outousai
